topic: How to design WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Designing WebAssembly (WASM) Targets with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer discusses the process of creating WebAssembly (WASM) targets using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the basics of FastAPI and WebAssembly
Setting up the development environment with Python 3.12+
Creating a FastAPI application that serves as a WASM target
Compiling Python code to WebAssembly using Pyodide or other tools
Integrating compiled WASM modules into the FastAPI application

code_examples.code: # Compile Python code to WebAssembly using Pyodide or other tools

version_notes: This guide focuses on Python 3.12+, but many concepts can be adapted for earlier versions with necessary adjustments.
Pyodide (or other WASM compiler) version may vary depending on the development environment.
caveats: Ensure you have the required dependencies installed before starting the project.
Comprehending the WebAssembly concept and its implementation is crucial for this task.
Development and deployment of WASM applications may require additional tools like Emscripten or Pyodide.
